intro: Lepidotis alopecuroides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, mat-forming perennial that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardy nature and attractive foliage.
